intro: Memora mollis, commonly known as the soft memory plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight. Memora mollis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is appreciated for its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
